intro: Saurauia hiranohottae, commonly known as the Hiranohot mountain laurel, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often on rocky slopes or in forest understories. Its leaves are leathery and dark green, while its flowers range from white to pink, adding ornamental value to its natural habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
